data.title: Blog Feed ‚Äì Just random med stuff
data.meta_description: All things med and all (and maybe non-med stuff, idk)
data.text:
If you‚Äôre reading this blog post, you probably received a text last February 26, 2019 from UERM saying ‚ÄúUERM Admissions. Please access the applicant‚Äôs portal to determine the status of your application to the UERM College of Medicine for SY 2020-2021.‚Äù

And if you opened the applicant‚Äôs portal and it said something like this: Congratulations! You‚Äôve been accepted in the College of Medicine.

Then congratulations to us! We passed and made it to the 1st list of accepted applicants at the UERM Ramon Magsaysay Memorial Medical Center, Inc. College of Medicine! Yay!

Medyo nakakatakot yung kasunon ng congratulations, for sure, kasi it‚Äôs saying that we have to reserve our slots already and enroll by March 13, 2020, or else our slot may be withdrawn. But don‚Äôt worry, I‚Äôve already enrolled so I have written this blog as a guide for you in process of enrolling for your first year of med school in UERM.

Here were the things I did to reserve my slots and enroll.

First, I went to UERM Admissions Office at the Ground Floor of the Administration Building. The administration building is the first building on your left as you enter the UERM Main Entrance (the one sa side ng Aurora Boulevard). Go straight until the end of the hall and you will find the admissions office on your right. You can go to the admissions office if you have some questions you want to ask, such as your lacking requirements, etc.

For me, I didn‚Äôt know where to go so they told me to go to the Registrar, which is located on the 2nd floor. You can proceed there by going up the stairs just in front of the admissions office and on the 2nd floor, you can find the Cashier, Accounting Office, and the Registrar.

From there, I proceeded to go to the Registrar‚Äôs office window and told them I am reserving my slot for the College of Medicine. The person told me that once I reserve my slot, I have to enrol agad so I needed to pay for the tuition already. Don‚Äôt worry, you can pay in installment naman or you can pay in full, if you‚Äôre rich and all that lol.

The person then told me to go inside the office and gave me a bunch of papers. First, I filled up a paper that said Information and Advising Form, There I filled basic information about myself such as name, address, birthday, place of birth, etc.. I also had to fill up the Senior High School I went to (I just put my high school in since we didn‚Äôt have SHS before pa) and the school I attended for my undergrad. There was a table at the bottom half of the page, which looked like the advising form, but I didn‚Äôt have to write anything on it.

Attached to that paper was a Data Privacy form chenes which I honestly didn‚Äôt read that much, but signed anyway haha. I was also given two forms, stating that I passed the College of Medicine and that I need to pay the non-refundable and non-transferrable reservation fee of 30,000 pesos. Don‚Äôt worry, they‚Äôll subtract that naman from the total fees you need to pay for the whole semester.

After filling up and signing the forms, I then went to the Cashier to pay for the reservation fee. You can pay in cash, cheque, or even debit and credit card. (Cheque should be payable to any of the following:

‚Äì UERM

‚Äì UERMMMCI

‚Äì UERM Memorial Medical Center

‚Äì University of the East Ramon Magsaysay Memorial Medical Center Inc.

For me, I paid credit card because despite having that money already in my bank account, I didn‚Äôt want naman na mawala agad sakin yun lol. I was given a receipt afterwards, which I gave to the person in the Registrar‚Äôs office again.

I was then given a form with the steps for the enrolment procedure, which I honestly which I had before para di na ako nagpa-ikot ikot and nahirapan tumawag sa admissions office lol. Anyway, I‚Äôve typed out the enrollment procedure and you can find it at the bottom of this blog post. I‚Äôm just detailing out the things I‚Äôve done here para mas informative.

After the Registrar‚Äôs Office, I proceeded to the Information Technology Office at the Nursing Building, 3rd Floor. From the Registrar‚Äôs Office, go down the same stairs you went up to then turn right to the hallway. After the couches, where you‚Äôll usually find students sitting down, there‚Äôs this small hallway you can pass and there you‚Äôll find the Nursing Building just on your left ng slight. You can use the elevator on your right or just take the stairs, like what I did.

If you took the stairs, turn right and there you‚Äôll find the IT Office. Enter the office and give your Information and Advising Form to them as well as your reservation official receipt. After encoding and assessment, you‚Äôll be signing something and proceeding again to the Cashier where you paid earlier and pay for the tuition na. Like what I said earlier, you can pay in full, or just partial if you‚Äôre doing installment.

The down payment I paid for the 1st installment was P19,732.00. It included the ID Fee na. It showed the subject code and the breakdown of fees, which I will be posting below as well. After paying, I was given another official receipt, which I then showed to the person in the IT office again.

After that, totally unprepared, it was picture taking time for my ID. Since I was not prepared and didn‚Äôt know my picture will be taken already, I didn‚Äôt have any makeup HAHA. But since you‚Äôre lucky I was able to write this and you were able to read this before enrolling, pls mag-ayos kayo kasi 4 years niyo rin yan suot lol.

For the picture taking, I was given a blouse which I wore over my top. Tip lang, just wear a thin t-shirt and preferably something na medyo mababa so that it won‚Äôt appear on top of the blouse or you don‚Äôt have to pull it down na.

After having my ID picture taken, the person behind the computer made me check the spelling and information to be shown on my ID. I then signed on this thing for my signature, then I was good to go.

Finally, the last step for the enrollment is the Annual Physical Check-up. Go out through the main entrance and on your left, you‚Äôll see an overpass you‚Äôll be crossing to go to the Infirmary Section of the Hospital (OPD-P.O. Domingo Bldg.).

Once you‚Äôve passed, you‚Äôll enter the College of Medicine just on your right, and there you can ask the guard na lang how to go to the Infirmary Section. Note that the Infirmary Clinic is open Monday to Friday from 8:30am-11:30am and 1pm-4pm.

Once you‚Äôre in the Infirmary Clinic na, give them your Official Receipt and a 2√ó2 ID picture. There, they‚Äôll be taking your usual information, vital signs, etc. You‚Äôll then be referred to get your XRay and CBC done at the building just across the infirmary. You‚Äôll be crossing the street for that.

And you‚Äôre done! Congrats! You‚Äôre officially enrolled! I hope to see you as we start our first year of medical school at UERM. If you have any more questions for me, you can tweet me or send me a DM at @randommedstud on Twitter.

Here are a few questions lang you may have, which I have the answers for LOL.

What are the things I need to bring for the enrollment?

You need to bring a pen to fill out the forms, money (P30,000 for the reservation fee and P19,732 for the 1st installment, if you‚Äôre not paying it full). You‚Äôll also need a 2√ó2 ID picture for the Physical Exam. Optional: Make-up for the picture taking and maybe a suklay para makapag-ayos ka before it HAHA.

What if I have not completed my requirements yet, do I need to bring them?

Yes! If you only gave photocopies or you informed them na to follow yung ibang requirements, then bring the original copies. You‚Äôll need a complete official transcript of records, certification of graduation or authenticated copy of diploma, transfer credential certification, original copy of NMAt score, and one long folder with plastic cover.

What if I‚Äôm still waiting for the results from another medical school?

You have the option to pay for the non-refundable and non-transferrable P30,000 reservation fee, or just give up your slot. It‚Äôs up to you whether you want to risk paying for it and not pushing through with the enrollment if you‚Äôll be attending a different medical school.

How can I apply for a scholarship?

I‚Äôve attached a picture below on the steps on how to apply for a scholarship and their deadlines. You can just refer to that picture.

What if I didn‚Äôt make it to the 1st list of accepted applicants? What are the chances of me making it to the 2nd list?

I honestly don‚Äôt know, since UERM did not disclose (as of writing this post) about how many passed the 1st list. However, I think there‚Äôs a high chance there will be another batch to be released once the 1st reservation period has ended, which will be on March 13, 2020. You may call the Admissions Office for more inquiries on that.

Anyway, that‚Äôs the end of my post! I hope I was able to help you in the reservation and enrollment process. Below, I‚Äôve typed down the enrollment procedure on the paper that was given to me, as well as the breakdown of tuition fee. Thank you for taking the time to read!

STEP 1

Proceed to the Registrar (2nd Floor, Admin Bldg) and submit the following entrance credentials for Enrollment:

a) Complete Official Transcript of Record

b) Certification of Graduation or Authenticated Copy of Diploma

c) Transfer Credential Certification

d) Original Copy of NMAT Score

e) One Long Folder with Plastic Cover

Secure Information and Advising Form. Have this form accomplished and signed by the Registrar or authorized Staff;

STEP 2

Proceed to the Information Technology (IT) Section Window 5 (2nd Floor, Admin Bldg) for encoding and assessment; (note: for my experience, I was asked to go to the 3rd floor, Nursing Building Room 301, Information Technology Department).

After assessment, check the details of your registration form and sign on the space provided on it.

STEP 3

Proceed to the Cashier Window 8 (2nd Floor, Admin Bldg) for payment;

Present your 3 copies of registration form together with your payment;

Secure printed O.R. and the student copy of your registration form;

Pay an ID FEE;

STEP 4

Proceed to the Information Technology Department (Room 301, 3rd Floor, New Nursing Bldg) for picture taking;

Present your O.R. ID Fee;

Have your picture taken.

STEP 5

Proceed to the Infirmary Section of the Hospital (OPD-P.O. Domingo Bldg) for annual Physical Check0up and submit the following requirements:

a) Official Receipt of Tuition Fee and Registration Form

b) 2√ó2 Photo ‚Äì 1 piece

YOU ARE NOW OFFICIALLY ENROLLED!

FRESHMEN ORIENTATION SCHEDULE

July 24, 2020 ‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äì Medical Students

Julu 17, 20-23, 2020 ‚Äî Freshmen BASIC LIFE SUPPORT TRAINING

July 28, 2020 ‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî- Parents

BREAKDOWN OF FEES, 1st sem 2020-2021

Lab. Fee ‚Äì 97,809.00

Tuition Fee ‚Äì 52,179.00

Library Fee ‚Äì 5,542.00

InfoTech Fee ‚Äì 2,452.00

Energy Fee ‚Äì 2,477.00

Health Serv. Fee ‚Äì 1,281.00

Registration ‚Äì 960.00

PE & X-Ray Fee ‚Äì 153.00

Student Service Fee ‚Äì 153.00

Sports and Cultural Fee ‚Äì 58.00

Psychological Exam Fee ‚Äì 728.00

MISCELLANEOUS

SCAADF ‚Äì 150.00

SCF ‚Äì 200.00

Publication ‚Äì 50.00

Insurance ‚Äì 55.00

Student ID-Card ‚Äì 320.00

TOTAL: 165,776.00

LESS: RESERVATION 30,000.00

CASH BASIS

Full Payment ‚Äì 135.776.00

INSTALLMENT BASIS

Down Payment ‚Äì 19,732.00

**BALANCE*** ‚Äì 120.686.00

UNIVERSITY SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAMS

A. Academic Scholarships

A.1.1 University Entrance

Entitles an incoming freshman student to free tuition, laboratory, miscellaneous fees, and a Php15,000 book allowance for one (1) school year.

Eligibility Requirements:

1. Must be Summa Cum Laude or Magna Cum Laude graduate of a baccalaureate course

2. Must have National Medical Admission Test (NMAT) score of at least 95 percentile

Documentary Requirements:

1. Accomplished scholarship application form

2. Certificate of graduation and proof of Latin honors

3. NMAT certificate (duplicate copy from CEM or printed electronic copy)

4. Letter of intent to apply for the scholarship

A.1.2 President Dalupan

Full Scholarship

Entitles an incoming freshman student to free tuition and laboratory fees for one (1) school year.

Eligibility Requirements:

1. Must have graduated with Latin Honors

2. Must have an NMAT score of at least 90 percentile

Documentary Requirements:

1. Accomplished scholarship application form

2. Certificate of graduation and proof of Latin honors

3. NMAT certificate (duplicate copy from CEM or printed electronic copy)

4. Letter of intent to apply for the scholarship

Partial Scholarship

Entitles an incoming freshman student to a 50% discount on tuition and laboratory fees for one (1) school year.

Eligibility Requirements:

1. Must have graduated with Latin honors

2. Must have an NMAT score of at least 85 percentile

Documentary Requirements:

1. Accomplished scholarship application form

2. Certificate of graduation and proof of Latin honors

3. NMAT certificate (duplicate copy from CEM or printed electronic copy)

4. Letter of intent to apply for the scholarship

COLLEGE OF MEDICINE NON-ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIP

Application Period: March 09 to May 31, 2020

Deadline of Submission of Requirements: June 19, 2020

COLLEGE OF MEDICINE ENTRANCE SCHOLARSHIP

Application Period: March 23 to May 24, 2020

Deadline of Submission of Requirements: June 05, 2019

Update March 9, 2020:

The portal for the Scholarship Application is now up! You may acces it at apps.uerm.edu.ph/scholarhsip/login. You will only be able to get your Student Number if you‚Äôve already reserved your slot and enrolled.

For other questions and inquiries, you may call or email the Admissions Office

Phone: +(632)8-254-4119 / + (632)8-715-0861 loc 205

Email: admission@uerm.edu.ph (Note: Although I‚Äôve emailed them before, no response üòÖ)

Office hours: 8am-12nn and 1pm-5pm PST
